[b][color=white]Forum Section Renaming[/color][/b]
If you think of some forum sections whose names have to be updated, you can suggest them in the dedicated thread as a voluntary effort. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6114850]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]HF Mobile App Teaser[/color][/b]
Finally, HF would be releasing it's official Mobile App. All iOS and Android users will be able to use Beta Release in the next couple of weeks. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6116335]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/technews-d3xus.png[/img][/align]



[b][color=white]The newest iPhone 12 won't come with a wall charger[/color][/b]
Fresh from their latest product event, Apple has announced that their latest iPhones line will include neither headphones nor a wall charger in the box. Apple cites these two items as often being thrown away by customers, who often reuse existing headphones or chargers that they already own. The move will reportedly reduce Apple's annual carbon footprint by more than two million metric tons of carbon emissions. However, for new iPhone customers, they'll need to go out and purchase a compatible charger for the phone.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.apple.com/iphone-12/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Microsoft and Dropbox to allow permanent work-from-home for employees[/color][/b]
Tech companies, and tech workers, have struggled to answer the question of how employees should or should not return to the office in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. Microsoft and Dropbox have taken the bold step of allowing all their employees the option of working from home permanently going forward. Dropbox is shifting their office culture to be remote-first, in which the expectation of employees will be in work from home environment. In Microsoft's case, employees who wish to work from home permanently should first consult with their manager. [i][size=x-small][url=https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2020/10/09/embracing-a-flexible-workplace/]>> Microsoft Source[/url][/size][/i] [i][size=x-small][url=https://blog.dropbox.com/topics/company/dropbox-goes-virtual-first]>> Dropbox Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]IBM to split into two companies[/color][/b]
IBM has announced that it will be splitting its 109-year-old company into two smaller titans of technology. The spin-off company, NewCo (final company name pending), will take on IBM's managed service infrastructure business and emphasize the modernization of its clients' IT infrastructure. IBM will remain focused on its hybrid cloud and AI offerings, such as IBM Cloud and IBM Watson. The split into two companies is expected to be finalized by the end of 2021. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.ibm.com/investor/events/ibm-strategic-update-2020]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]
